name: Chicken House
description: Large-scale broiler housing producing substantial litter annually

current.description: Traditional poultry operations generate significant waste with disposal costs and environmental liabilities

inputs.label: Fresh Pine Shavings
inputs.description: Traditional bedding material sourced externally. Standard transportation costs with regular replacement schedule.

inputs.label: Chicken Feed
inputs.description: Primary nutrition source with efficient conversion ratio. Major operational expense.

outputs.label: Live Chickens
outputs.description: Healthy birds ready for processing. High annual bird production across multiple flocks.

outputs.label: Dead Chickens
outputs.description: Mortality higher in current practice due to poor air quality from ammonia emissions. Significant economic loss.

outputs.label: Used Poultry Litter
outputs.description: Contaminated bedding with high ammonia levels compared to proposed system. Disposal costs required. Major environmental and health concern.

issues: High ammonia emissions affecting bird and worker health
Higher mortality from poor air quality

proposed.description: Biochar-enhanced poultry operations with circular nutrient management and improved air quality

inputs.label: Fresh Pine Shavings
inputs.description: Same bedding material but enhanced with biochar. Creates superior environment for birds with better moisture management.

inputs.label: Biochar
inputs.description: Carbon-stable soil amendment produced from pyrolysis. Significantly reduces ammonia, improves bird health, eliminates disposal costs. Valuable market price with grant support available.

inputs.label: Chicken Feed
inputs.description: Same feed as current practice but birds have better feed conversion ratios due to improved air quality and reduced ammonia stress.

inputs.label: Labor
inputs.description: Farm workforce managing biochar-enhanced operations. Better working conditions due to reduced ammonia exposure.

inputs.label: Crops
inputs.description: Agricultural products benefiting from biochar-enhanced litter and digestate as organic fertilizer inputs.

outputs.label: Live Chickens
outputs.description: Healthier birds with lower mortality. Better foot health. Premium pricing possible for biochar-raised poultry.

outputs.label: Dead Chickens
outputs.description: Significantly reduced mortality due to better air quality and reduced ammonia stress. Major economic benefit.

outputs.label: Litter & Char
outputs.description: Valuable resource instead of waste! Enhanced litter goes to anaerobic digester for energy production. High phosphorus and nitrogen recovery. Zero disposal costs.

benefits: Reduced foot damage (chicken feet have significant value)
Grant support available for biochar-enhanced litter
Premium pricing in some markets for biochar-raised poultry

technicalDetails.scale: Large-scale broiler house with high annual bird production
technicalDetails.litterComposition: High nitrogen and phosphorus content in bedding material
